jobs.title: Solutions Consultant-ERP Integrations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Higharc is a VC-backed startup that is changing how new homes are designed and built. Join a founding team who’ve shipped products for Autodesk, Electronic Arts, Nike, and Apple. We have rasied a total of $83M with support from top-notch venture capital firms and more than 18 strategic investors—industry leaders in construction, building products manufacturing, and distribution.

The Solutions Consultant - ERP Integrations plays a critical role in delivering customer value by ensuring seamless, scalable integration and adoption of Higharc’s solutions. This role is both strategic and hands-on: you will lead successful ERP integrations (e.g. CSV/API) into homebuilder purchasing systems, empower operational teams (P&E, S&M) to adopt our products, and own key outcomes across implementation, data, and usage.

Success in this role requires strong project management, deep functional understanding of homebuilder workflows, and the ability to guide integration strategy from scoping through execution. You’ll act as the customer-facing contact for ERP/CRM integration and data transformation efforts while aligning with internal teams to drive fast, effective outcomes.

Job Responsibilities:

Solutions Consultant - ERP Integrations

  • Act as the primary liaison for technical integration projects (ERP, CRM, data pipelines), ensuring successful API and CSV workflows.

  • Own the end-to-end implementation of integration workstreams, including scope alignment, issue resolution, QA, and launch readiness.

  • Translate customer data models and operational workflows into requirements and configuration plans for Higharc solutions.

  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Solutions Consulting to deliver standardized, repeatable integration frameworks.

Customer Adoption & Value Delivery

  • Drive adoption of Higharc tools within Purchasing & Estimating and Sales & Marketing teams.

  • Identify and remove barriers to adoption, unlock early value, and champion product usage across customer accounts.

  • Build relationships with key stakeholders to cultivate champions and drive organizational change.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Project Management

  • Lead customer projects with urgency and clarity — managing timelines, milestones, risk, and stakeholder communication.

  • Partner with Customer Adoption, Product, Engineering, and Sales to coordinate integration and adoption plans.

  • Represent the voice of the customer in roadmap discussions, ROI reviews, and QBRs.

Training & Enablement

  • Develop and deliver customer-facing materials, training playbooks, and best practices for adoption and integration.

  • Support internal enablement by educating other CSMs, Implementors, and Solutions Consultants on integration and rollout frameworks.

Customer Advocacy & Outcomes

  • Articulate the value of Higharc’s solutions in terms that resonate with builder stakeholders.

  • Analyze integration impact and product usage data to surface insights, risks, and expansion opportunities.

  • Contribute customer stories and testimonials that demonstrate measurable ROI.

Required Qualifications:

  • Proven track record of successfully managing technical integration projects (CSV/API) for ERP, CRM, or estimating platforms.

  • Strong project management skills with an ability to drive cross-functional execution and manage multiple priorities.

  • Experience in Purchasing & Estimating, and familiarity with homebuilding software systems (MarkSystems, BuilderMT, NewStar, Salesforce, etc.).

  • Excellent communication skills; capable of translating between technical teams and business users.

  • Customer-centric mindset with a focus on outcomes, speed, and value delivery.

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment and proactively solve problems.

  • Bonus: Familiarity with the AEC industry or experience in vertical SaaS implementation or solutions roles.

Working at Higharc

Higharc has been remote first since our founding in 2018. We offer flexible hours so you can do your best work without missing out on life. Higharc offers competitive salaries with significant equity, in a fast-growing, well-funded company.

Personal healthiness is an important value for us- we provide comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, with unlimited PTO, and meaningful maternity/paternity leave to all U.S based employees that are full-time. You'll also have access to other big-company benefits such like short and long-term disability plans and a 401K. Haven't worked remotely before? We provide a stipend to create the ideal home office.

About the Role

We are seeking a VP, Adoption to lead our post-sales organization and drive operational excellence in delivering complex technical implementations involving transitions from traditional CAD tools to Higharc. This role requires someone who can build scalable systems, build and run a pro services P&L, and establish world-class implementation methodologies while maintaining the speed and agility required in our fast-paced startup environment.

Reporting: This role reports directly to the CEO

What You'll Do

  • Build a world-class professional services business inside Higharc with scalable systems and methodologies that account for the unique challenges of construction industry technology adoption. Enable rapid growth while maintaining operational excellence. Manage as a stand-alone P&L.

  • Oversee enterprise-grade implementations of Higharc’s web-based BIM system for production homebuilders — create the playbooks and project management norms for rapidly and predictably transitioning customers from traditional “pen and paper” processes to Higharc

  • Develop high-performing teams including second level managers, implementation leads, specialists, and trainers. Drive accountability through clear KPIs, measurable ROI, SOPs, and cross-training programs. Advocate for the use of AI, automation, and non-conventional approaches to continually improve processes & reduce adoption time.

  • Lead strategy and growth for adoption, running experiments with consulting, training, and managed services offerings (eg. drafting and design); help builders ship more homes, faster, with less waste

  • Collaborate closely with product managers to represent the voice of the customer in product strategy and development, ensuring user needs are translated into feature requirements that drive customer success.

  • Develop comprehensive training and adoption programs that ensure customers can fully leverage Higharc's advanced capabilities including AI and automation

What You'll Bring

Core Experience

  • 10+ years leading complex technical implementations in BIM, AEC software, construction technology, or similarly disruptive enterprise platforms

  • Proven P&L management experience with accountability for business unit profitability, resource optimization, and scalable growth

  • Professional services leadership with demonstrated success building consulting, training, and managed services organizations

  • Track record in startup or high-growth environments where you've driven significant operational transformation under pressure

  • Experience managing distributed teams composed of 40+ employees based across the US and abroad

Technical & Industry Expertise

  • Deep understanding of AEC workflows and the challenges of migrating from legacy systems (CAD, manual processes) to modern platforms

  • Experience with disruptive technology adoption in traditional industries, particularly construction, manufacturing, or engineering

  • Knowledge of BIM implementations, integrations, and the technical complexities of construction software deployments

  • Understanding of homebuilding operations and production builder workflows preferred

Leadership & Business Acumen

  • Exceptional change management skills with experience leading teams through significant operational and cultural transformation

  • Strong business discipline with ability to drive efficiency improvements, cost optimization, and process standardization

  • Data-driven leadership approach with experience establishing metrics, dashboards, and performance management systems

  • Executive presence and communication with ability to present to C-suite stakeholders and manage complex client relationships

Innovation & Problem-Solving Excellence

  • Drive process innovation with demonstrated ability to optimize workflows for improved efficiency and scalability

  • Apply systems thinking to complex operational challenges and implementation design

  • Balance startup agility with enterprise-grade execution standards and quality delivery

Focus relentlessly on customer outcomes and measurable business impact

Working at Higharc

Higharc has been remote first since our founding in 2018. We offer flexible hours so you can do your best work without missing out on life. Higharc offers competitive salaries with significant equity, in a fast-growing, well-funded company.

Personal healthiness is an important value for us- we provide comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, with unlimited PTO, and meaningful maternity/paternity leave to all U.S based employees that are full-time. You'll also have access to other big-company benefits such like short and long-term disability plans and a 401K. Haven't worked remotely before? We provide a stipend to create the ideal home office.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Geometric Modeling/CAD
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Higharc is a VC-backed startup that is changing how new homes are designed and built. Join a founding team who’ve shipped products for Autodesk, Electronic Arts, Nike, and Apple. We have rasied a total of $83M with support from top-notch venture capital firms and more than 18 strategic investors—industry leaders in construction, building products manufacturing, and distribution.

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to contribute to our core geometric modeling technologies that support design, presentation, and analysis of homes. The right candidate for this role prioritizes working software over perfection and wants to deliver code, get user feedback, and iterate. We are remote-first, this role can sit anywhere in the continental US.

What You’ll Do

  • Solve geometric modeling problems: Conceive and implement algorithmic solutions to the most difficult geometric modeling problems

  • Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with other engineers, product, and customer success teams to define expected behavior, discover gaps in existing product, and ultimately ensure customers are happy

  • Test: Write tests to verify that your code can handle the worst corner cases.

  • Mentor: Mentor junior developers to write code as robust as yours.

About You

You have a strong interest in geometric modeling and understand the tradeoffs between different modeling techniques such as meshes, BReps, NURBS, and BSPs. Ideally you have a strong interest in the homebuilding industry, whether it's a passion for homes, construction, or home design and you’re motivated by the prospect of elevating an entire industry through geometric modeling. Your ability to be hands-on, while also focusing on the bigger strategic picture, sets us apart. You're not hesitant to deeply understand our codebase to contribute effectively to it.

You also have:

  • 5+ years of experience working in CAD or geometric modeling

  • Knowledge of geometric modeling concepts techniques such as but not limited to meshes, BReps, NURBS, and BSPs.

  • Familiarity with graphics API’s like WebGL, WebGPU, and OpenGL.

  • Demonstrated proficiency with TypeScript/JavaScript

  • Able to understand and navigate a large TypeScript + React codebase

  • Natural curiosity and a keen interest in staying abreast of new technologies and testing methodologies

  • Good understanding and working knowledge of website management, modern marketing tools, and CRM (e.g. Hubspot, Webflow, etc.)

Higharc is a VC-backed startup that is changing how new homes are designed and built. Join a founding team who’ve shipped products for Autodesk, Electronic Arts, Nike, and Apple. Higharc is reimagining home design and construction. We’re seeking a Senior Engineering Manager to lead development of Higharc Studio, our browser-based 2D and 3D CAD design tool. This role is central to realizing Higharc’s vision: an accessible, intelligent design environment for the future of homebuilding.

You’ll lead a team building a high-performance CAD experience that runs entirely in the browser—spanning computational geometry, 3D visualization, and rich interactive editing. You’ll combine strong technical leadership with deep expertise in frontend architectures, web graphics, and the design challenges unique to CAD systems.

This role reports to the VP of Engineering and is remote within the US or Canada.

What you'll do

  • Lead the design, planning, and delivery of engineering projects within Higharc Studio.

  • Partner closely with the Building Generation team—a sister group that owns the building model and computational geometry stack powering Studio. While Building Generation defines the model’s structure and behavior, the Studio team brings it to life in an interactive 2D/3D browser environment. Together, these teams form the core of Higharc’s design experience.

  • Drive architectural and technical decisions for Studio’s frontend systems, ensuring performance, maintainability, and a delightful user experience.

  • Balance rapid iteration with systematic improvements to quality, testability, and technical debt reduction.

  • Develop and mentor a high-performing team of engineers, fostering technical depth, accountability, and collaboration.

  • Partner with product and design leaders to translate creative vision into scalable, performant, and intuitive tools.

  • Shape and champion processes that sustain speed without sacrificing craftsmanship.

You might be a good fit if you have

  • Deep experience building and leading teams delivering complex, interactive 2D/3D applications in the browser.

  • Strong technical background in frontend architecture (React, TypeScript, WebAssembly, Web Workers).
